title: What makes a song such as Stairway to Heaven better than a song such as Yummy by Justin Bieber? - Quora

response.answer_text: In one sense, nothing. Yes, “Stairway” has lasted as an iconic song for nearly fifty years. But I’m sure there are people alive right now who will associate “Yummy” with some youthful delight or triumph, and will remember it fondly to the end of their days. “Stairway” can take you on an eventful journey, like the best of Seventies rock. From the acoustic guitar intro all the way to the final line, it keeps changing and tells a musical story. Like all the best music, it can give a deep emotional experience. And while it’s highly popular, it wasn’t intended as a hit - hell, it wasn’t ever released as a single - it was just the result of Jimmy, Robert, JPJ, and John coming up with something they thought was a good song. But “Yummy” doesn’t change because it doesn’t need to change - it starts perfect and it ends perfect, and everything in-between is the same, is perfection. The effects and the programmed beat and and the Autotune are the last word in Big Time professional hit production. They sound like every other Big Time hit, but that’s OK. You might be able to dance to “Stairway,” but you probably wouldn’t think of doing so; that’s not the kind of song it is. You wouldn’t necessarily think of how Zeppelin look when you hear it, just how they sound. But “Yummy” forces you to dance, forces you to notice what a cute bad boy Justin is, and that’s the whole point of it. Anything else is just subjective value judgments. Ultimately, it doesn’t mean anything. You’d have to wait another fifty years, and see if “Yummy” develops the same kind of iconic reputation that “Stairway” has, to make any meaningful comments or comparisons.

That particular song is better because there are different parts to it, so it goes slow, faster, slow again. Also, the imagery is faerie-like …. those lyrics are so beautifully-written. Yummy is much better to dance to, because of the beat of course. But Stairway To Heaven is much classier!
